intro: Draba macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces distinctive, large seeds that are dispersed by wind. Draba macrocarpa is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, cold environments.
